name: 黃瀅瑛
objective: This course will focus on the understanding of consumer behavior through consumers' decision-making processes as well as consumers' attitudes towards certain products. How and why do consumers make their consumption choices, how do they think and act during the processes, and do they feel satisfied or dissatisfied with their decisions? Various underlying concepts and topics will be discussed (e.g. perception and cognition, human behavior, user experience, ergonomics, human-centered design, policy and social norms, product development, etc.)
schedule:
Week 01: Course introduction and announcement (Sep. 24)
Week 02-03: Introduction to consumer behavior (Oct. 1/Oct. 8)
Week 04-05: Consumer decision process (Oct. 15/Oct. 22)
Week 06-07: Pre-purchase process  (Oct. 29/Nov. 5)
Week 08-09: Purchase process (Nov. 12/Nov. 19)
Week 10: TBD (midterm assignment) (Nov. 26)
Week 11: Post-purchase process (Dec. 3)
Week 12-13: Individual differences (Dec. 10/Dec. 17)
Week 14: Influencing consumer behavior (Dec. 24)
Week 15: No class (Dec. 31)
Week 16: Final project presentation - Part I (Jan. 7)
Week 17: Final project presentation - Part II (Jan. 14)
Week 18: TBD (final exam week)
scorePolicy:
In-class assignment(s) & participation: 25%
Individual report or mid-term exam: 35%
Final project: 40%
materials: Blackwell, R. D., Miniard, P. W., and Engel, J. F. (2006). Consumer Behavior (10th ed.). Mason: Thomson.
